labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.20-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/68134
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck216261@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Win 11/Chrome, Pixel 8a/Android 16
**App Component:** User Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Create a workspace
3. Go to Account >> Wallet
4. Click "Add bank account"
5. Start adding bank account on the workspace or in the wallet (Make Payments option)
6. Exit the flow on any of the step
7. If you're not on the Wallet page, go to the Wallet
8. Click partially added bank account (with Action required badge)
9. Verify that the page with Continue Setup appears
10. Click Continue Setup
11. Verify that you can continue the setup from the step you left
12. Tap app back button until you reach Confirm currency and country page
13. Observe blank currency/country fields displayed
14. Go back & click Start Over >> Yes, start over on popup
15. Select Log into your bank
16. Observe blank currency/country fields displayed

## Expected Result:
Currency/Country fields should not be blank when navigate back from step left for partially setup BA

## Actual Result:
Blank Currency/Country fields when navigate back from step left for partially setup BA

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @suneox 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771052507161919)

## Action Performed:
1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ (or production)
2. Navigate to any **DM chat** (not workspace/policy chat)
3. Create a new expense without specifying a merchant (leave merchant field empty)
4. Click on the created expense to edit it
5. In the merchant field, enter **"Expense"** or **"(none)"**
6. Click Save
## Expected Result:
DM expenses should reject invalid merchant values or display saved values
## Actual Result:
1. **No validation error** - "Expense" or "(none)" saves successfully
2. **Merchant not displayed in list** - The merchant field shows empty in expense details
## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @justinpersaud **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771080908183879) ## Action Performed: 1. Set a daily category limit of $15 CAD 2. Charge an expense near the limit (e.g., via Expensify Card in foreign currency) 3. Ensure the displayed CAD amount is slightly below the limit (e.g., $14.98 CAD) 4. Submit/view the report 5. Observe violation ## Expected Result: If the displayed amount is $14.98 CAD, no over-limit violation should trigger. ## Actual Result: Expense displays $14.98 CAD. Report shows an over-limit violation for exceeding $15 CAD. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

2. Ensure the account has $0 billing months (e.g., due to card usage credits)
3. Navigate to: NewDot → Subscriptions → View payment history
4. Observe that no entries appear for $0 months

6. View billing history for the same months

- Distance rates are already enabled, and add other rates than the default

and login

3. Try to select the available rate switch

5. Verify that the corresponding switch is announced as Default Rate, [currency][amount] / mile, on, switch.

Switch is only announced as "Default Rate, [currency][amount]", and the "on or off, switch" is still not announced with the screen reader on Distance rates

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+021326dr003@applause.expensifail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** MacOS 26.2 / Chrome, Safari. iPhone 16 Pro / 26.3. Google Pixel 5 / Android 14
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
1. Login with new Expensifail login
2. Create new workspace, toggle Expensify card feature ON, invite new member
3. Setup bank account for use Expensify card

Steps:
1. Go to WS > Expensify card
2. Click "Issue card"
3. Select Member
4. Follow the flow until magic code page, enter magic code
5. Verify the new card was issued
6. Repeat steps 2-5 to issue a 2nd card

## Expected Result:
Magic code is required to issue each new card

## Actual Result:
Magic code is required only when issuing the first card after login. No magic code is required for other cards.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: 
User A is a new user created on https://staging.expensify.com by selecting "Organize my own expenses". The "Get paid back from my employer" option was selected from the intent selector during the onboarding flow.
In NewDot, create a valid scan expense and submit it to a non-existent account (User B).

1. Go to User B's email inbox
2. From the email with the subject "Please pay expense", copy the link "open it in Expensify" (can be found in the footer) 
3. Change the link to staging and navigate to it
4. Go to the expense details
5. Tap on Pay $X.XX > Pay with business account
6. Tap on Log into your bank account
7. Complete the Plaid flow
8. Approve the expense
9. Tap on Pay $X.XX
10. Navigate to the Concierge chat

## Expected Result:
The onboarding tasks are displayed for manage my team expenses.

## Actual Result:
Some onboarding tasks, like "Take a test drive", "Connect your corporate cards", and "Set up categories", are missing.

Unknown

## Action Performed:
Pre-condition: Login with an expensifail account with an Expensify card added (virtual)
1. Launch app
2. Go to workspace settings 
3. Tap Expensify card
4. Note blank issue card state is shown briefly before displaying cards added
5. Tap on a card added 
6. Tap edit card name -महामन्त्रस्य, वशिन्यादि वाग्देवता ऋषयः, अनुष्टुप् छन्दः, श्री ललिता पराभट्टारिका महा त्रिपुर सुन्दर

8. Note error for character is shown for 100 character limit
9. Go to wallet
10. Tap import transaction 
11. Tap card name 
12. Enter name used in step 6 and save
13. Note no character limit error is shown
14. Now enter any alphabets more than 100 to trigger error
applausetester+vsca@applause.expensifail.comapplausetester+vsca@applause.expensapplausetester+vsca@applause.expensifail.comifail.com
and  save
15. Note 100 character limit error

## Expected Result:
Character limit error must be shown for sanskrit characters in personal card name field.

Blank issue card state must not be shown briefly before displaying cards added.

## Actual Result:
Character limit error is not shown for sanskrit characters in personal card name field.

Blank issue card state is shown briefly before displaying cards added.

Unknown

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.19-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** No
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/81626
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck21226@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create an expense with negative amount. - for eg: -100
4. Open the expense report.
5. Click More > Split.
6. Click any split amount field.
7. Place the cursor at end of amount & clear the field using backspace key (or hitting x button on iOS keypad) but leave the negative sign.
8. Observe the other split amount changes its value to -95
9. Go back & tap More > Split
10. Select the entire amount in any of the split field but leave the negative sign
11. Hit delete key & observe other split amount retain it's value i.e -50

## Expected Result:
On step 8 - The other split amount field keeps its current value (no change) when deleting the other split using backspace key.

## Actual Result:
On step 8 - The other split amount doesn't retain it's current value when deleting split amount in one of the field using backspace key.

## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @brianlee-expensify 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771011934206629)

## Action Performed:
**Prerequisites:**
Have Expensify Cards enabled at the workspace level (must select the workspace to be the "Preferred Workspace" in Expensify Card settings)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Set certain Expensify Cards with a $0 limit or issue a new card to yourself with $0
2. Switch over to New Expensify
3. Click Workspaces > [workspace] > Expensify Card
4. Check to confirm if the Expensify Cards with a $0 limit appear in New Expensify

## Expected Result:
Expensify Cards with a $0 limit should still appear in New Expensify, so that admins have the ability to raise the limit back up to reactivate the card in NewDot
## Actual Result:
Expensify Cards with a $0 limit do not appear in New Expensify, so admins currently need to go back to OldDot in order to raise the limit back up to reactivate the card in NewDot
## Workaround:
Unknown
